other_tests.findings: Biatrial enlargement, massive functional tricuspid insufficiency (ERO 0.72 cm2, 70 ml regurgitating volume), and Gerbode type defect observed.

Structural changes in the right cardiac chambers, previous extra-institutional atrial cardiorrhaphy, and a defect communicating the left ventricle with the right atrium above the tricuspid valve were identified.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Satisfactory closure of the tricuspid valve and Gerbode's defect reported on follow-up transesophageal echocardiogram.
